sampleSuggestions.title: Development Standards & Architecture
Maillard note: dry surface for browning
sampleSuggestions.suggestion: For better browning, pat proteins dry and avoid overcrowding the pan; use a hot pan and enough fat to reach Maillard temperatures.

sampleSuggestions.title: Plating: add color or height when absent
sampleSuggestions.suggestion: Consider a bright finishing garnish (herbs, citrus zest, pickles) or a crunchy element to add color and texture.

Recommend tasting and seasoning
sampleSuggestions.suggestion: Consider adding a step to taste and adjust seasoning (salt and acid) before serving.

sampleSuggestions.title: Development Standards & Architecture
Poultry low-temperature safety note
sampleSuggestions.suggestion: This recipe references low-temperature cooking for poultry. Ensure it includes safe time/temperature notes (e.g., 60°C for 2 hours for pasteurization) or use higher temperatures to guarantee safety.

sampleSuggestions.title: Recommend resting meat after high-heat cooking
sampleSuggestions.suggestion: After searing/roasting, consider resting the meat for a few minutes (or longer for roasts) so juices redistribute and slices stay juicy.
